data.title: Funky, creative, original arts and crafts
data.text: Looking for that unique gift?  Try this craft art store in downtown St. Pete,  Great works in clay, multi-media, glass, jewelry, all very unique.  Some of the art is expensive, but there are great choices at a more moderate price.

data.title: Interesting local art shop
data.text: We like to sample local culture when traveling and Florida CraftArt helped meet the need for us in St. Petersburg. It is located in the central arts district downtown that is itself a destination to go walk around and check out all the unique shops, bars, and restaurants.  Florida CraftArt is a big, nice, shop as much as it is a gallery with pieces to purchase from $5 to $5000 and everywhere in between. We bought Christmas ornaments and stocking stuffers for our kids but had finances been just a little better we would have bought something to display at home. There were many things I had never seen anything like before which was refreshing.

data.title: Definitely worth your time!
data.text: On a recent trip to Indian Shores Beach, my wife and I decided to take a break from the beach and head to St. Petersburg for the Mural Walking Tour, held every Saturday at 10 a.m. We met our tour group and docent at the Florida CraftArt center in the Central Arts District. For the next hour-and-a-half, we saw and heard the background of 36 murals that spanned 4 blocks. These graffiti-inspired works of art covered building after building with creative, colorful impressions. Laura, our delightful docent, shared her knowledge and passion by bringing these murals to life for us. Most notable were "A Moment to Remember," "Lizard King," and "Eye of the Storm." Tour costs $19 for adults, $11 for children ages 6-18, & are free for kids 5 and under. Well worth the cost! Also appreciated the complimentary cold bottle of water on a hot day! Reservations not required but recommended! If you're looking for something different to do, the Mural Walking Tour might be what you're looking for. Also take some time to browse the local art in the Florida CraftArt Center to find some unique, personal pieces.

data.title: Loved it!!!  If you love Art, stop in
data.text: Cannot say enough about Florida CraftArt.  We were spending the day in St. Petersburg and had just left the Museum of Modern Art and decided to stop in at Florida CraftArt.  Since my husband and I really enjoy and appreciate the work of local artisans in different media, we were not disappointed.  This is not a large place, but exquisite, unusual, beautiful creations.  We happened to arrive during a basket weaving workshop and were invited to join in.  So we did.  Spent the next hour weaving a small basket (including my husband).  What fun.  The ladies were part of a larger basket weaver's guild and were more than happy to show us what to do.  What a fun way to spend the afternoon!!  But if nothing else, please go and see the wonderful work of the artisans.  You will not be disappointed.

data.title: Wonderful 3D Art
data.text:
My husband and I visited the Florida CraftArt Gallery and were pleasantly surprised.  There was none of the usual art gallery fare of paintings, photography and giclees.  They have an awesome variety of Florida artist 3D works of art! They carry beautiful handmade jewelry, pottery, 3D wall art, wood sculpture and much more.  Very unique and different items that would be great for gifts.

They also had a very interesting art exhibit in the adjoining space.  We would go back. It is located in the Arts District of St Petersburg which is a great location.  Restaurants all around and other art galleries and museums. The Morean Art Center Hot Shop is only about a block away and is also worth a visit.

data.title: Who are these artists?
data.text: Walking into the gallery, you're first impressed with the diversity of the art work.  But viewing deeper, you'll notice that some objects are mark with artist name tags and others aren't.  Even asking the attendant about the artist who are unmarked, they'll have no idea who the artist is, much less any biographies that can be gleaned.  This shows the viewer that there are only a few artists feature, as others are simple fillers for gallery space.  Florida CraftArt expresses in their mission that they help support the fine craft made in Florida.  It sound great, but until they provide name tags with biographies of each artist, some could be cheap, off shore products that are simply brought in by the Galllery Manager to help fill space.......NOT A GOOD IMPRESSION.....as it comes across as deceptive.  As such, beware of what you buy at this location.

data.title: Local Art & Fine Craft
data.text: The shop is legendary for the amount of quality hand made items. The temporary shows are always interesting and stretch the concept of "craft"

data.title: Astonishing pieces
data.text: Really loved the exhibit, I was helped by an old lady who was a volunteer there - forget her name unfortunately. She has an amazing taste.

data.title: My favorite shop for local artists
data.text: I love this place when I want to get a gift for someone that is made by a local artist right here in Florida.  Whenever I travel anywhere and know that I want to take gifts to friends and family that is made by local Florida artists this is where I go.  They have an incredible selection of art works from paintings to jewelry.  By the way this is where I get all my jewelry and I am always complimented on the pieces that I wear.  I highly recommend you stop here.

data.title: Great place to buy local art
data.text: I love this place, they have very cool artwork from local artist.  Perfect place to find a gift for someone that has everything, or something super cool for your own home 😉

data.title: Nice variety of artwork
data.text: If you are in the Central Arts District of St. Pete, put this on your "must do" list. There is a wonderful assortment of artwork and display and for sale by local acclaimed artists. A variety of mediums are represented....drawings, oil paintings, water color paintings, photography, mixed media, metals, fiber, glass, and more. There is something for everyone and the items are always changing. You will not be disappointed.

data.title: Depends on Your Taste
data.text: If you like modern art this is a great place for you.  If you are into traditional you will be disappointed.

data.title: Well Chosen Pieces in a Bright Setting
data.text: Being in the arts business ourselves, we tend to be very critical of such places. This is a cut above. The buyer has unique taste. The space is light and bright. Prices are a tad high. Merchandise display needs improvement. But overall, it's better than most.

data.title: A Crafty Place, this + Tourist Info
data.text: Eclectic mix of crafts and art by local artists. You can find unusual gifts or souvenirs to suit any budget. THE place to start gallery hopping since the volunteers who work here are also fonts of info about St. Petersburg. Advised us about coupons in a tourist brochure  that saved us money on our visits to the MFA and the Dali.

data.title: Beautiful crafts, well worth a look
data.text: There were probably 10-12 items I would have left with, if I'd had room in my luggage. Delightful selection of wall art, jewelry and wearables for every budget. I'm so sorry I didn't go back and buy the bracelet I was coveting - but I'll be back!

data.title: Every town should have a venue like this!!
data.text: For an interesting collection of art by local artists, this place is hard to beat..  It is like a mini museum, with top notch items beautifully displayed.  Items big and small from inexpensive to "high limit charge card"... A great beginning to the Art Walk

data.title: Interesting collection of local art
data.text: For those interested in purchasing art by local St. Petersburg artists, this is a great gallery.  A broad array of artistic media (oil, glass, fiber, ceramic, etc.) and well selected to show the quality of local work.  Worth a visit even to just browse.

data.title: Always Evolving and Varietal
data.text: One of my favorite galleries, like a mini museum with many objects for sale, both expensive and affordable..Great stop on Art Walk Saturdays..

data.title: Unique Experience
data.text: This is a place to stop by to see what local artists can really do. They have unique items from unknown artists that they determine are up and coming. Each item is one of a kind and you are helping a struggling artist to keep doing what they do best. Every time I visit, there is something new. I think if you stop by once a month you will find new and interesting items that you have the opportunity to buy. I love this place and wish I had more time off to visit more often.

data.title: Best Ever!
data.text: If you're looking for a taste of Florida Art, this is the place to go. It's filled with beautiful, affordable works from all over the state and I doubt you could find a friendlier staff anywhere!

user_location.name: New Port Richey, Florida, United States
